title: Your iPhone Needs a Job
subtitle: How to Automate Your Mornings with ChatGPT + Shortcuts
author: TechTiff
content_html:
Every morning, my iPhone and ChatGPT have a meeting without me. They check my weather, unread emails, calendar events, and reminders, then ChatGPT builds me a clean summary text. All before I wake up.

Most people spend their first 20 minutes of the day in a reactive scrolling, checking, catching up. This system buys your focus back.

A few months ago I wrote about this shortcut and it became one of my most-read pieces. The DMs I got? “…but HOW do I actually build this?” So I made you a video and walk through the step-by-step setup.

The System

This shortcut runs in 4 parts:

  1. Gather: Pull data from Weather, Mail, Calendar, Reminders

  2. Summarize: Send everything to ChatGPT with custom instructions

  3. Text: Deliver the summary as a text message

  4. Automate: Set it to run every morning without you

Here’s what it does: Every morning, your iPhone checks your weather, unread emails, calendar events, and reminders, then sends everything to ChatGPT, which builds you a clean summary text. All before you wake up. No more opening 5 different apps. No more 20 minutes of morning admin.

The prompt that handles the summary:

You are reviewing emails, events and tasks, then prioritizing today's critical updates.

For weather: only include today's low, high, and whether it's going to rain. 
For emails: only include messages written to me by a person. 
For events: just the time and name. 

Output this as a summary in 1-2 sentences using hyphens as line breaks between sections.

If you’ve got an iPhone and ChatGPT, you can set this up in about 10 minutes.

Also, I’m launching a YouTube channel for exactly this: visual breakdowns of the automation systems I build. This is video number one. If you want more iPhone shortcuts, AI workflows, and systems that make your phone work for you, subscribe. I’ll be dropping these weekly.
